intro: Navarretia heterandra, commonly known as the Sierra snowplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to grow in high-elevation environments, often in rocky or gravelly soils. It is part of the flowering plant family Montiaceae and is known for its ability to survive in cold, harsh climates. Navarretia heterandra is also notable for its historical use by indigenous peoples for medicinal purposes.
